section.title: Folksonomy Management
section.para: The Folksonomy allows you to manage tag styles. The tag style will be changed depending on the number of documents in a tag.
Go to Sites Administration, then Ontologies, and finally, Manage Folksonomy.

section.title: Edit
section.para: To edit existing tags, do as follows:

step.title: Step One
step.para: Click the icon that corresponds to the tag name which you want to edit in the Action column to edit the tag style configuration. The Edit tag style configuration form will appear:
Details:

listitem.para: To give the number of document assigned to the same tag. (*Required).
To include font-size, font-weight, colour, font-family, text-decoration. (*Required).

step.title: Step Two
step.para: Change values for fields: Style name, Document range. Html single

step.title: Step Three
step.para: Click Update to save new changes, or Cancel to quit this form without changing.

listitem.para: You cannot edit the style name.
The format of valid range must be: a..b with 'a', 'b' are positive integers. You can use * instead of 'b' to indicate it is unlimited.
The 'Html style' text box cannot be empty: you can change values of font-size, fontâ€“weight, color, font-family, text-decoration.

section.title: Delete a tag style
section.para: An administrator can delete a tag style by clicking the trash icon that corresponds to the tag style which an administrator wants to delete. There will be a message which confirms the deletion:
Click OK to accept deletion, or Cancel to quit without deleting the tag style

section.title: Add a tag style
section.para: Furthermore, an administrator can add a new tag style as follows:

step.title: Step One
step.para: Click the Add style button. The Add tag style configuration form will appear:

step.title: Step Two
step.para: Input values for fields: Style name, Document range, Html style, all of which are required.

step.title: Step Three
step.para: Click Update to accept adding a new tag style, or Cancel to quit without adding a new tag style.

formalpara.title: Tag Permission Manager
formalpara.para: The Tag permission manager tab helps administrator set permissions regarding editing and deleting public tags.

step.title: Step Four
step.para: Click the icon to select memberships in order to add a permission for those memberships. The Select membership form will appear:

step.title: Step Five
step.para: Select a group on the left and the corresponding membership on the right. The selected membership will appear in the Membershipsfield:

step.title: Step Six
step.para: Click Save to accept adding a permission for the selected membership of the selected group. The selected membership that has just been added a permission will be listed in the Memberships column.
An administrator can also delete memberships that have been set permissions by clicking the Delete icon relevant to that membership. A confirmation message will appear:

step.title: Step Seven
step.para: Click OK to accept the deletion, or Cancel to quit the form without deleting.

section.title: Manage Taxonomy Trees
section.para: A Taxonomy may be understood as a classification practice and science. It is used to sort documents, aiming at facilitating searches. The Taxonomy management includes adding, editing and deleting a taxonomy tree. Go to Sites Administration, then Ontologies Manage Taxonomy Trees.

section.title: Add a Taxonomy Tree
section.para: Perform the step in to add a taxonomy tree.

step.title: Step One
step.para: Click the Add Taxonomy Tree button to add a new taxonomy. The Add taxonomy tree form will appear.

step.title: Step Two
step.para: Enter the taxonomy tree name in the Name field. (*Required).

step.title: Step Three
step.para: Select the workspace you want to work with.

step.title: Step Four
step.para: Select the home path by clicking the plus item. The Select Home Path form will appear:

step.title: Step Five
step.para: Click the tick icon if you want to select the root path or click the arrow icon to go to the up level path. Click the plus sign to expand the folder.

step.title: Step Six
step.para: Click the tick icon corresponding to the path that you want to select as a home path.
Click Reset if you want to reset values that have just been selected or Next to select permissions for a taxonomy tree.

step.title: Step Seven
step.para:
Click the
icon to select a user or the
icon to select memerships or the
icon to select everyone in order to set permissions. The user or memership that you have just selected will be displayed in the User or Group field.
Then, check at least one of these below options to set rights for the selected user to membership:

listitem.para: The option is to select the read right or not.
The option is to select the Add Node right or not.
The option is to select the Set Property Right or not.
The option is to select the Remove right or not.

step.title: Step Eight
step.para: Click Save to save all values, or Reset to change values that have just been set. After clicking Save, click Next to go to the next step.

step.title: Step Nine
step.para: Enter the name for an action of the taxonomy tree in the Name field. (*Required).

step.title: Step Ten
step.para: Select values for Lifecycle, NodeTypes, Target workspace, Target path, Affected Node Types. (*Required).

step.title: Step Eleven
step.para: Click Save to save all values and, click Next to go to the next step.

listitem.para: Do not input some special characters in the 'Name' field like: !,@,#,$,%,&,*,(,).
Do not add a taxonomy which has the same name and level with existing taxonomies in a node.
The taxonomy name must contain less than 30 characters.

You cannot delete taxonomies that have been referenced.
